description: Aerological Observations at the Upper Air Station at Cambridge Bay, Nunavut
full_summary:
### Request for Proposal: Aerological Observations at Upper Air Station at Cambridge Bay, Nunavut

#### Solicitation Number
5000071623

#### Scope of Work
Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) is seeking a contractor to provide aerological observations at the Upper Air Station in Cambridge Bay, Nunavut. The contractor will be responsible for preparing instruments and conducting daily upper air soundings to monitor temperature, humidity, and atmospheric pressure levels.

#### Key Dates

* Publication Date: 2023-11-22
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-12-22T09:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: None
* Expected Contract End Date: None

#### Contract Type
The contract will be awarded through a competitive bidding process with the following evaluation criteria:

* Technical Merit
* Price

#### Security Requirement
The contractor must comply with the Contract Security Program of Public Works and Government Services Canada.

#### Trade Agreements
This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)

#### Additional Information
For more information, please contact Caitlin Andersen at (289) 812-9507 or Caitlin.Andersen@ec.gc.ca.

#### Attachments
The complete request for proposal, including the scope of work and evaluation criteria, can be downloaded from the following link:

https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/25480/5000071623_upper-air---cambridge-bay-nu_rfp_en_final.pdf
https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/25480/5000071623_upper-air---cambridge-bay-nu_rfp_fr_final.pdf

#### Language of Service
Services will be provided in both official languages, English or French.

#### Socio-Economic Benefits
Environment and Climate Change Canada encourages bidders to identify socio-economic benefits provisions, including
